data.name: RL#1:  Restaurant menu format
data.description:
# RealLife #1: RESTAURANT MENU FORMAT
The other day I was creating a menu for my parents restaurant 
as for the tenth time. I was working again in the repetitive task of **separating perfectly the name of the product and the price with dots so it can perfectly fit in one line**. Then I fugured that it can easily be solved by a program. And here we are.

# What do we want?
Imagine you got limited space on a page, in Monospace 12 you can place 30 characters on each line, you will have to use all the space available. 
* If the product name and the price uses more than 30 characters you have no space to place in. 
* If product name and the price uses less than 30 characters you have to fill the gap with dots.

So, your task is to format ProductName and Price into something like this: 
```
[CapitalizedProductName][Dots as filler][$Price]
``` 
And join them into a single string separated by **\n**

# Here is an example:
A program that given **DATA** (an array like this):
```
[["PRODUCT", 1], ["PRODUCT", 10], ["PRODUCT", 100], ["PRODUCT", 1000]]
```
and **MX** (max line length) = 30, returns:
```
PRODUCT..................$1
PRODUCT..................$10
PRODUCT..................$100
PRODUCT..................$1000
```
# String conditions
* Return each line separated by **\n** in a single string
* Separate name and price with dots
* There is at least one dot
* Return empty string if there is no data
* A line never can be longer than **MX**
* No white spaces at the beginning or ending of product name
* No white spaces at the end of each line
* Product name has to be in capital letters
* Im mexican so i want the **$** symbol before the price
* If there is no space between name and price, return **None**
